title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 160.13 - Original applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 160.13 - Original applications

State Regulations

In determining qualifications and fitness of an applicant
for original licensure pursuant to article 27 of the New York General Business

Law, the secretary shall conduct a review of factors unrelated to prior
criminal history, including, but not limited to: (a) findings of violations related to any
provision of article 27 or any regulation adopted thereunder; (b) findings of unlicensed practice of nail
specialty, waxing, natural hair styling, esthetics or cosmetology; (c) findings of failure to pay taxes or of
tax liens; and
(d) findings of
failure to pay child support. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
160.13

Adopted

New

York State Register May 6, 2015/Volume XXXVII, Issue 18, eff. 5/6/2015

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
